channel.title: Comments on: How I Ended Up With Vim

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/03/02/how-i-ended-up-with-vim/#comment-4450">Danny Howard</a>.
Indeed, more GUI editors need a vi-mode.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Danny Howard.

Indeed, more GUI editors need a vi-mode.

item.title: By: Danny Howard
item.dc:creator: Danny Howard
item.description:
The thing is, once you get into vi / vim it is harder to to switch to anything else. H J K L means you can move around your document without going so far as off the typing section of the keyboard, and any moderately experienced user has learned tricks for replacing text, &c. that make using, say, a GUI-based editor, painfully slow.
I use vim all over my desktop, in addition to servers. :)
